name: Siebenrock’s Snake-necked Turtle
description: Its notably long neck folds sideways in an S-shape rather than retracting into the carapace. The carapace is nearly flat with thin, smooth shields.
image_alt: Siebenrock’s Snake-necked Turtle, photo: Petr Velenský, Prague Zoo
attractions: It spends most of its life in deep mud of coastal wetlands, feeding almost exclusively on fish, snails, worms, and other mud-dwelling invertebrates.
breeding: A pair arrived at the Indonesian Jungle Pavilion in 2004, with the first offspring raised in 2009.
